# PTD Today Monthly (Last 30 Days) Intelligence Brief

## 1) Top Themes
- Growth and deployment of solar PV projects globally, including UK, US, India, Bangladesh, and Nepal.
- Offshore wind advancements with China leading in turbine capacity and major projects such as Hornsea 3 ownership changes.
- Rising importance and integration of AI in renewables (floating PV digital twins) and data centers.
- Supply chain and domestic content mandates in battery storage and solar manufacturing.
- Disruptions in subsea infrastructure impacting data connectivity (subsea cable cuts).

## 2) Top Stories
- China retains lead in single-unit offshore wind turbine capacity with Vestas's 15 MW turbine installed offshore (Source: offshorewind.biz).
- UK solar market poised for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployment in 2026 (Source: pv-magazine.com).
- Apollo acquires co-ownership stake in Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm (Source: offshorewind.biz).
- Indian battery storage projects mandated to include 20% domestic content (Source: pv-magazine.com).
- Finnish police seize vessel suspected of damaging subsea cable and detain Russian crew, highlighting security risks to data transmission infrastructure (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).
- US solar market forecasted to reach 737.8 GW capacity by 2035 (Source: pv-magazine.com).
- Tata Power Renewable completes 1 GW Domestic Content Requirement-compliant solar PV project for SJVN in India (Source: pv-magazine.com).
- New AI-powered digital twin developed for floating PV applications, enhancing operational modeling and optimization (Source: pv-magazine.com).

## 3) Sector Takeaways

### Grid/Transmission
- Security concerns rise as subsea cable sabotage incidents occur in Finnish waters, potentially disrupting data centers and transmission (datacenterdynamics.com).
- US states are mandating utilities to enable more flexible grid connections to support community solar growth (pv-magazine.com).

### Renewables
- Offshore wind capacity continues to scale with advances in turbine size and strategic ownership changes (offshorewind.biz).
- Solar PV deployment accelerates globally with record CfD auctions in the UK, major projects in India and Bangladesh, and ambitious US capacity targets (pv-magazine.com).
- Policies such as India's domestic content requirements aim to boost local manufacturing for battery storage and PV projects (pv-magazine.com).
- Innovation intersects with renewables as AI-driven tools like digital twins are adopted for floating solar PV management (pv-magazine.com).
